conclusion: Establish coordinate system with square abcd boundaries and particle entry point S.
Description of the electric field between plates MN and PQ.
Condition for straight-line motion between plates: magnetic field B direction and velocity v direction.
Magnetic force direction for negatively charged particle is downward.
Electric field E must be downward to balance magnetic force for straight-line motion.
Equilibrium relation: |q|E = |q|vB leading to v = E/B.
Particle motion after leaving point O: uniform circular motion under magnetic force.
Radius of circular motion R = mv/(|q|B).
Center of circular motion located directly below point O.
Geometric condition for 'just failing to exit': L + R = 2L leading to R = L.
Combine equations to solve for v: mv/(|q|B) = L leading to v = |q|BL/m.
Final result: velocity of particle at point S is v = |q|BL/m.
